dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, so, uh, big news coming out of Kazakhstan today, huh? All about those evacuation flights.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, so, uh, big news coming out of Kazakhstan today, huh? All about those evacuation flights.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, A. I saw that. Like, a lot of movement, especially, um, between Dubai and Doha, heading back to Almaty and Astana.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, A. I saw that. Like, a lot of movement, especially, um, between Dubai and Doha, heading back to Almaty and Astana.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today, June 25, Kazakhstan™s airlines are operating six flights from Dubai and Doha to Almaty and Astana to evacuate passengers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it's all about getting passengers home from those previously canceled flights, which, you know, makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it's all about getting passengers home from those previously canceled flights, which, you know, makes sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To evacuate passengers from previously canceled flights, the airline is organizing additional repatriation flights, the ministry said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But the interesting bit, I think, is how they're doing it. They're actually, um, bypassing quite a few countries' airspace.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But the interesting bit, I think, is how they're doing it. They're actually, um, bypassing quite a few countries' airspace.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I caught that! Six countries, right? Iran, Israel, Iraq, Jordan, Syria, and Lebanon. [overlaps] Like, a pretty big detour.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I caught that! Six countries, right? Iran, Israel, Iraq, Jordan, Syria, and Lebanon. Like, a pretty big detour.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Flights to the Middle East are still being operated by bypassing the airspace of six countries: Iran, Israel, Iraq, Jordan, Syria, and Lebanon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Right, a significant detour there, for sure. Shows you, um, the current complexities of air travel in that region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, a significant detour there, for sure. Shows you, um, the current complexities of air travel in that region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And today, June 25th, they've got, like, six flights going, according to the Ministry of Transport.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And today, June twenty fifth, they've got, like, six flights going, according to the Ministry of Transport.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today, June 25, Kazakhstan™s airlines are operating six flights from Dubai and Doha to Almaty and Astana to evacuate passengers. Details were provided by the press service of the Ministry of Transport.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and SCAT Airlines is really stepping up. They've started evacuating citizens from Qatar specifically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and S C A T Airlines is really stepping up. They've started evacuating citizens from Qatar specifically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, SCAT Airlines has begun evacuating citizens from Qatar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm. I saw the first Doha-Almaty flight departed already, this morning, uh, 7:35 AM local time, with 213 people on board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm. I saw the first Doha-Almaty flight departed already, this morning, uh, seven:thirty five A M local time, with two hundred thirteen people on board.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The first Doha-Almaty flight departed today, on June 25, at 07:35 a.m. local time in Qatar with 213 passengers on board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, and there's another one scheduled for later today, a Doha-Astana flight. That's, um, 2:30 PM local, with even more passengers – 290.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, and there's another one scheduled for later today, a Doha-Astana flight. That's, um, two:thirty P M local, with even more passengers - two hundred ninety.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additionally, a Doha-Astana flight is scheduled for today as well, with a planned departure from Doha at 2:30 p.m. local time. The expected number of passengers is 290.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, a really coordinated effort to just get everyone, uh, repatriated after those earlier disruptions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, a really coordinated effort to just get everyone, uh, repatriated after those earlier disruptions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And remember, Air Astana had actually announced they'd resume flights to the Middle East starting today, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And remember, Air Astana had actually announced they'd resume flights to the Middle East starting today, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, Air Astana announced that it would resume flights to the Middle East starting June 25.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, that's right. So it's all kind of, um, coming together today then, with these additional, like, emergency flights.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, that's right. So it's all kind of, um, coming together today then, with these additional, like, emergency flights.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, seems like a busy day for Kazakh airlines, making sure everyone gets home safely, even with the long routes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, seems like a busy day for Kazakh airlines, making sure everyone gets home safely, even with the long routes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Quite the logistics challenge, but good to see they're, uh, getting it done.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Quite the logistics challenge, but good to see they're, uh, getting it done.
